questions.question_text: Which lookup table does the Default Account Activity Detected correlation search use to flag known default accounts?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The Default Account Activity Detected correlation search in Splunk Enterprise Security uses the "Privileged Accounts" lookup table to flag known default accounts. This table contains information about accounts with elevated privileges, including default accounts that could pose a security risk if used maliciously.

comments.content: The wording of this question is bad. Known default accounts could be assumed to be for Administrative or for VIPs. However, C is the likely answer for the question due to the identities lookup you can set the user to be flagged as a default account. A and D implies you are monitoring VIPs or elevated users, which the question is not asking.

discussion.content:
Should be A.
Reference: https://community.splunk.com/t5/Splunk-Enterprise-Security/Default-Account-Usage-Correlation-Search-All-user-as-default/m-p/333887
Also, you can run | inputlookup administrative_identities.csv to see the content.

Selected Answer: A
Splunk_TA_ForIndexers.spl is good for initial configuration, but *updates* are done with the Distributed Configuration Management tool.

Selected Answer: A
https://community.splunk.com/t5/Splunk-Enterprise-Security/Splunk-Enterprise-Security-requires-a-deployment-client-but/m-p/279749

Distributed Configuration Management is the tool used to update indexers in Splunk Enterprise Security (ES). This includes deploying configuration updates and managing the deployment of apps and add-ons, such as Splunk_TA_ForIndexers.spl, to indexers across the environment.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct - ref: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/ES/7.1.1/Install/InstallTechnologyAdd-ons

questions.question_text: Which tool is used to update indexers in ES?
How is it possible to specify an alternate location for accelerated storage?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct - Ref: https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/ES/latest/Install/Datamodels#Configuring_storage_volumes

choices.A: Use the tStatsHomePath setting in indexes.conf
choices.D: Configure storage optimization settings for the index.
choices.C: Use the tstatsHomePath setting in props.conf
choices.B: Update the Home Path setting in indexes.conf

questions.question_text: After managing source types and extracting fields, which key step comes next in the Add-On Builder?

discussion.content: D is correct - Ref: Pag 195 - "Administering Splunk ES 7.1"

choices.B: ES extracts local email and web domains automatically from SMTP and HTTP logs.
choices.C: ES uses the User Activity index and applies machine learning to determine internal and external domains.
choices.D: The Corporate Web and Email Domain Lookups are edited during initial configuration.
choices.A: Web and email domain names are set in General –> General Configuration.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. Page 140 "Administering Splunk ES 7.1"
Edit any of the Domain
lookups:
– Corporate Web Domains
– Corporate Email Domains
– Cloud Domains (external vendor sites)

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer
